meanings.sent1: I will revie my notes before the exam.
meanings.sent2: She likes to revie her favorite book every year.
meanings.sent3: Let's revie that movie and see if we missed any details.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to revie the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: I need to revie my schedule to make sure I didn't forget anything important.

meanings.sent1: The teacher's revie of the student's project was helpful.
meanings.sent2: The company conducted a revie of its financial performance.
meanings.sent3: The movie revie praised the actors' performances.
meanings.sent4: The art critic's revie of the painting was insightful.
meanings.sent5: I read a revie of the new restaurant before deciding to try it.

meanings.definition: A written report or article giving a critical evaluation of a work or performance.
meanings.sent1: The revie of the play in the newspaper was positive.
meanings.sent2: She wrote a revie of the latest album for the music magazine.
meanings.sent3: The revie of the movie made me want to watch it.
meanings.sent4: I always read the revie of the book before buying it.
meanings.sent5: The revie of the art exhibition was featured in the local magazine.
